page.title: 20Wild Life around Braiseworth
page.content: In our area there are quite a few rabbits which eat the crops,much to the dislike of the farmers.Hedgehogs are very common near Green Farm,but it is sad to see so many squashed on the road.In the fields we can find mice and voles. On the farms you can find wild cats which feed on the mice.When one group was out for a walk they spotted a weasel. There are also stoats and moles which can quite easily be seen from the tracks.Our area is rural so there are plenty of wild mammals also there is a variety of birds especially birds of prey,that my class likes.Tamsin Pitt thinks fox-hunting is cruel because she likes foxes,she saw one once on her way home on a dark night,it ran across the road. This information has been compiled by the Junior class of Occold School and Mrs. Fathers,part-time teacher.
